items.summary: As family violence survivor and mother-of-two, Maya was assessed as a high priority for social housing. Eight years later, she's finally moved into a suitable home in outer-suburban Melbourne, with vulnerable Victorians left waiting for years as the social housing waitlist soars.

items.title: GIM Trading accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors with 'low risk' bonds
items.summary: A Gold Coast musician approached by a man he knew from a local bar went on to front a trading company, later accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors.

items.title: The higher Australia's 2035 emissions target, the more necessary a carbon tax will be
items.summary: Australia's emissions reduction number is, in short, a laugh-or-cry-o-meter, or perhaps more accurately, a tax-o-meter.

items.title: The year Australia is due to blow its carbon budget
items.summary: Unless Australia lifts its ambitions, its "fair share" of carbon emissions will be spent 14 years early. With the government announcing a 2035 climate target this week, there is intense debate on how high the government should aim — and whether it will be enough to help limit global warming.

items.title: Liberal Party immigration fight is a battle over how the party wants to position itself
items.summary: Immigration has become a new fault line inside the Liberal Party that will erupt again.

items.title: Reece Walsh grabs the Sun to lead Brisbane to an all-time victory over Canberra
items.summary: Brisbane and Canberra went to the great beyond in their golden point finals match and it was Reece Walsh who led the Broncos to the promised land.

items.title: Belgians break Australian hearts in Davis Cup classic

items.title: Jess Hull cruises to 1,500m final at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo
items.summary: Jess Hull made light work of a rough semifinal to progress in the women's 1,500, but Linden Hall and Torrie Lewis both fell just short of making the final themselves.

items.title: Perth had its wettest winter in 30 years. Why aren't its dams full?

items.title: Children missing out on early intervention for language delays due to shortage of speech pathologists
items.summary: One in four children starting school now has a speech or language delay. It can hold back their learning, affect their friendships and harm their mental health. Speech therapists are struggling to find ways to support them all, but one school is leading the way.

items.title: Independent accreditation system for fertility sector to be established as all recommendations of IVF review accepted
items.summary: Federal Health Minister Mark Butler has announced he has accepted all recommendations of a rapid review into the IVF sector at a meeting with state and territory health ministers in Perth.
